name: Uterine Arteriovenous Malformation (UAVM)
chief_complaint: Heavy vaginal bleeding and pelvic pain after recent miscarriage
prognosis: Good with prompt treatment, but high risk of recurrence if not completely treated. Can be life-threatening if bleeding is uncontrolled.
description: A rare vascular anomaly where abnormal connections form between uterine arteries and veins, often triggered by pregnancy events (miscarriage, D&C, or cesarean delivery). The fragile vessels can rupture causing life-threatening hemorrhage. Diagnosis requires high clinical suspicion and imaging confirmation.
